inn1.comm: and indeed there is some swing first up, the ball keeping fairly flat and sneaking back in zippily to the lefthander who creeps over to defend
on leg this time, a touch shorter too, and that's tucked very easily off the hips to square for a quick single and to get off the mark
a good line this time and the batsman is quiet in defence, facing his first ball there
tries a bouncer which delights the crowd, but not the umpire, that one zooming late on its way through
another wide, over leg stump again, and the bowler's trying a bit too hard here. Tennis ball bounce on this pitch
pushed up there this time, straighter too, and that's guided into the leg-side quietly
on leg this time - Taylor just struggling with his line here - and that's tucked off the hips but rolls straight to the fielder
a better line, on off, and that rises up late at the batsman, but only thigh height, and he defends it down without alarm
he runs rhythmically into bowl, but that's a (very) loosener, simply spraying that way down the off-side like an errant cannon
tightened the screws this time and that's fired down the off channel, but not near enough to the batsman to make him play, and he leaves the ball easily

oh, Powell got some good lift off the track there which surprised Jayasuriya, who leaps into the air, like a martial artist, to flay that back through cover - but he didn't get hold of it and it, in its turn, leapt in the air, but safe
swishes this one to square
roars from the crowd, more than the team, that one swinging in but it was going down leg-side. Nice seam position
flings the ball down off, again just a touch shy of the ideal line, and that's left alone
that one flies through at shoulder height, down the channel, the batsman swaying gently out of the way
driven to the man at cover
tickled behind point and there's an easy run on

questioning line down off, tight at the batsman and he can't make as much room as he'd like to play that down off the back foot to third man, squeezing it awkwardly out and there's an attemped run out, but a wayward throw
no dramas with this ball, harmlessly down the channel outside off
over the wicket to the lefthander, by the way, and that's defended stoutly on the front foot
well bowled indeed, squaring up Tharanga a touch and he had to play (and miss) off the back foot

Taylor revs up and runs in, and there's some good cricket there, as they say, a sharp delivery, coming back into the batsman but Jayasuriya does well to poke it down into the covers quickly and they run through - textbook makers take note
a touch loose and that's played off the back foot behind point
slower ball and that's driven out to mid-off slowly
lovely stuff from the bowler... ah, apart from his overstepping there, zooming that one through at a fair lick, zipping off the seam and past the batsman's outside edge
defended forward
on leg, but a testing delivery - short and rearing at the batsman's chest; he fends down solidly enough
driven to cover
defended forward
a very quick single, played to third man from the toe-end of bat
driven to cover
slightly harsh decision with the wide there, perhaps, then again he's taken his umpiring test and I've not, that one shooting down off
tucked that in front of square and Tharanga sets off, but he has to run back to his line pretty soon
took the pace off the ball there this time, enabling the run, as it wasn't travelling so quickly to the fielder. The single is tidy enough
defended down into the leg side
straight, pushed up there and the batsman has to defend down off the back foot
tucked down off the back foot in front of midwicket
tries a yorker, gets the length wrong, and that's a mere push of a straight drive, well timed and that one runs away
bangs that one in, and it lifts... and lifts... the batsman swaying away as it whooshes past his helmet

he's gone! An early strike! There was just a little bit of movement and the batsman plays all around it, two stumps being knocked out of the ground in the process. Well, Powell deserved that one - he's been asking the questions and finally he has his answer
Sangakkara made to play his very first delivery, defending just outside the off stump, a quiet one just pressed forward
pushed right up there and defended right over this one
plays that very well, a lateish cut stroked down behind point
defended this time
short - but not that short - and that's pulled superbly through midwicket, keeping his eyes on it all the way and springing into the shot
another attempted bouncer, alas it's once again too high
outside off, but that's too high for the umpire's liking, hitting above the roll, as the call comes in for lbw, and they scamper the leg bye
defended down to round off the over
seamed away and Jayasuriya wafted at it - a very late waft - nearly getting an edge, or indeed he may have guided that straight into the hands of the slips off the face. But in actuality he missed it
steers that one down off the legs to fine leg and there's some sharp work from Sarwan with a tracer shy
up there, nearly a yorker, and kept out with some digging around the toes
that's too wide to play with, although he does have a game swish outside his off stick
slower ball, but that's a harsh wide I'd say, just to say straying down leg
defended tidily on the front foot
on middle and leg, a touch short of a good length and that's worked in front of midwicket and the easy single is taken, well, easily
round the wicket and that's defended down off the back foot
tasty - just short of a good length and that's wide of a diving Bravo at second slip. The fielder at third man, was a good man, Samuels diving to keep it in play
short and walloped off the back foot through point - too short, not enough pace, and that's an easy way to open your 4 column

just in the right zone and Sangakkara was squared up by that one and he offers the thinnest of edges, a size zero of a snick, through to the keeper. Again, West Indies deserve this wicket and there's much work for Sri Lanka's top order to be getting on with in these early stages
overstepping and that will frustrate Bradshaw
defended this time
off the mark with one which he works square and any thoughts of two are quashed by some sharp fielding
pushed up there and that's defended into the covers
left alone this time
another good ball and that's defended down
defended forward once more
left alone outside off
driven to mid-off
wide, slashed to point but not hit as hard as he wanted
airy drive, very loose with his head looking at anything other than the ball, and no surprise that he misses it by some way
worked off his pads to short fine leg
that went straight as an arrow, down the leg side and taken around his ankles by Ramdin
driven to the right of Smith at backward gully , he dives to soon and then has to make a rather undignified scramble on his knees to make the ground to enable him to intercept the ball
into the leg side but not into space
onto the back foot, squirted off a thick and well-controlled edge to third man
outside off stump, it seamed in a little but no need for the batsman to do anything other than stand tall and lift his bat out of harm's way

very wide and short, slashed past backward point - lots of oohs as the crowd thought it might have been a chance - but more drama as Jayawardene set off for the second and was halfway down by the time he was sent back. Quite safe as the throw had to come in from the boundary edge
wide and short again, slammed to point where Bradshaw makes a good stop
flicked off his hips to square leg
angled across the left-hander, not a sniff of movement and Jayasuriya lets it pass
shorter but still angled across Jayasuriya who again leaves it
Jayawardene spars at the ball as it is angled across him, lovely delivery
this time Jayawardene into line to one much straighter
he pushes forward unconvincingly, an uncontrolled edge into the leg side
right into line and defensively pushed into the covers
a consistent line from Bradshaw, Jayawardene blocks
onto the back foot and played off an open face to the left of backward point, far enough away for Jayasuriya to call for the single
inswing, a bit gentle, but  a good accurate start
run down to third man -  76mph
Jayasuriya opens the face and runs the ball down to third man, letting the pace of the ball do all the work
flicked off his hips to long leg
a big stride forward and a solid defensive push
Jayasuriya takes two steps down the track, pushes the ball to point but Lara is on it quickly and no chance of a run
Jayawardene stands tall and blocks
fuller and slightly slower - 71mph - driven to mid-off

thuds into the pads and drops at Jayawardene's feet, Jayasuriya calls for the quick single, he is safe and so Ramdin throws at the bowler's end stumps, misses and carries on all the way for four overthrows
dug in slightly shorter, Jayasuriya back and drops the ball into the covers
Jayasuriya back and watchfully defends (79mph)
down the leg side, the ball tickles the batsman's pad and Ramdin takes it well ... cheers from some of the crowd who anticipate it might have been a catch
pushed gently to mid-on
fended down into the gully
back and into the covers, the fielders in like bees round a thingy to gather it
very correct defensive push back at the bowler's feet
on the spot once more, Jayawardene can only pat it to mid-on
this time Jayawardene is given the room to free his arms and he unleashes a cover drive ... four on most days, but on a soggy and heavy outfield, it's pulled up just inside the rope
Jayawardene stands tall and blocks
full and a crisp drive, mid-off makes a sprawling stop to his right
too full and wristily whipped to the right of mid-on, again the outfield is sluggish and even though it was timed, it didn't have the legs to go all the way
short and Jayasuriya on it like a flash, pivoting and helping the ball down to long leg
two steps and hammered over mid-off for a one-bounce four. A clear change of strategy here, and about time
steered to backward point, and a quick single made less risky by a misfield
a little width and too full, Jayasuriya launches that high over the covers
more middle-stump line in response, Jayasuriya content to block
Jayasuriya steps down the track - risk free as Ramdin back - and driven high and hard back over the bowler's head. Straight as a die
on the spot and blocked
slower ball, Jayasuriya sweeps behind square
bad ball, pure and simple, short and wide and smacked off the back foot through the covers
Jayawardene rather reaches for the ball and so his drive to extra cover lacks power
Jayawardene back and punches the ball to cover
more a middle-stump line, turned to mid-on
again back to block (84mph)
Jayawardene back, drops the ball to the leg side but Taylor changes direction athletically and swoops to pick up
back and again nothing more than a prod to cover. A maiden from Taylor, just what Lara needed after the last couple of overs' carnage
forward and into the covers
pulled down the leg side by Gayle, and Jayasuriya seizes onto it quickly and pulls it down to long leg
another bad delivery from Gayle, well down the leg side, this time he doesn't get hold of the ball and Gayle escapes
long hop, pulled again to long leg, Powell has gone a bit finer and he fields well, a good throw but the pair are running well
wide well down the leg side. Gayle is really all at sea. Four consecutive balls down the leg
and a fifth ... swept this time straight to Powell at deep square leg.
up in the blockhole and clipped to square leg
dabbed down off the back foot behind point
presents the face of the bat and that's defended with a pleasant, clean "Clock" sound into the covers
played wristily down off the back foot behind point
comes down the track and ... defends, the batsman just adjusting at the last minute
tucks that one across and there are more overthrows, this time from Smith, shying in and pretty wide of the stumps in the end, beating the man backing up behind the wicket
tidy ball ends the over, forcing the batsman to adjust his drive into a defence, again at the last second
poor fielding from Brian Charles at short midwicket. He made the effort to run over, and got a fingertip on it, but stayed down and didn't try to chase the ball
defended forward
driven to mid-off, timed well, but the placing was less impressive, the ball rolling straight to the man
strays down leg just too much and the bowler huffs back to his mark, his tongue sticking out, thinking about the ball just bowled
a scrambled single as that one's knocked into the covers
slower delivery, very good, just running his fingers over the seam and Jayasuriya read that one very late, nearly popping a leading edge back to the bowler
right idea, but poorly executed
a touch outside off and the batsman just about manages to squeeze the ball out behind point

Jayawardene comes a long way down the track, plays, and at the other end Jayasuriya has to get well back in his crease as the throw comes in from midwicket - the garbled "No" giving him a clue to get back
dibbled to square this time and Jayasuriya set off, but had to get back
worked to square
mistimed the off-drive there, the batsman just struggling to move his feet
more defence which will encourage Taylor
low full toss swished off the shins behind square and that single means he keeps the strike
zigzagging swing there, and the ball cuts back off the seam, too, with the ball on the rise - great ball and the batsman did well to get nothing on it
more convincing shot, opening his shoulders and briskly late-cutting that one behind point
customary cut behind point, well timed - a very decent shot for a single, that
shimmied off the toes behind square
over the wicket, by the way, and that pitches straight and it's worked just in front of square off the toes, a tidy shot
that's driven wide of mid-on and there's a bit of a chase for Sarwan down there
pushed right up there, on the money, and that can only be defended
worked out to third man for an easy single
short and that's a huge crack of a shot. Great timing and Jayasuriya just plants his foot down the track and lifts that in front of midwicket and it travels
pushed right up there and neatly worked to square
yorker, but well dug out
lovely hands there, that one's timed well, too - taking the ball from the off stick and planting it well in front of square
a slight hint of width and that's turned nicely to midwicket
pushed right up there and defended forward
pushes that one just across the lefthander, it straightens and Jayasuriya can only defend forward yet again
shortish, wideish and that's driven to cover
turned behind square and that runs to the man just inside the boundary
picked the gap well, swinging that one wide of mid-on and that races away
turned off the hips but straight to the man at midwicket
can't find the gap again, picking out midwicket, again
took the pace right off the ball this time and the batsman looked to work it straight
good shot for none, there, Jayawardene coming down the track and looking to carve that one off the back foot to gully, does so, but it's well snapped up
quick single to mid-on
outside off and that's defended into the covers
steps down the track and that aerial drive clears the boundary over cow corner, but that was no moo, just a clean, crisp shot to bring up the 100 partnership from 112 balls
slower ball, didn't quite get the targeting right, a full toss that kept low at the pads; even so they're quite a tricky height to dig out, so the batsman did well enough in defending
slings that one wide down off and Jayasuriya hoicks at it. Ramdin got hit in the face trying to get his body behind the ball there as it bounced up awkwardly at him. But he's OK
dragged down the leg side and that's swivelled round very fine indeed, but some pacy work at the fence keeps it down to three
short, slower delivery and that's well played, the batsman waiting for it and late cutting it sweetly, from a crouching position, behind point

pushes that one across the lefthander who stands tall and looks to use the width and rising height to work that behind point, but while he gets the full face on the ball, he doesn't really get hold of the shot and the ball bounces down softly
straight and that's worked to midwicket without much power
defended solidly this time
shimmies down the track a few times - like a horse jostling for position at the start of a race - but in the end moves back to play that off the back foot just into the leg side
on leg, short, and flicked away off the legs - four from the second it left the bat, bisecting the fielders a treat
very quick single into the covers
pushed onto his back foot there and he tries to drive back into the covers
defends this one
still not finding the right line and that's worked behind square
"deft!" says Martin, admiringly, as that's short and late cut down to third man
worked behind square
wide, but Jayasuriya reached out to try to sweep that
worked out in front of point for an easy single
on off and Jayawardene goes to drive that forcefully, but doesn't quite time it, and that's driven out to mid-off
good line, good length, patted into the leg side
hit hard into the ground on onwards to deepish mid-off
chopped from close to the body to third man, just wide enough of him to allow the quick second
full, but far from a bad ball, picked up in a trice and deposited over the midwicket boundary. Remarkable shot and only someone with a remarkable eye could have seized on that so quickly
similar shot but less power and a single to the man in the deep
prodded with an open face to point
well wide down the leg, poor ball for one delivered so slowly
gently pushed to long-off
the end result is the same, the ball is driven up the ground to the man in the deep for a single
swept round the corner, straight to short fine leg
Jayasuriya steps back, waits, and punches the ball to long-off
fetched from outside off stump towards the square-leg boundary, and with no fielders out there, it's a safe shot
into the leg side, midwicket in quickly
dropped but a great effort .... swung from outside off to deep midwicket, Chanderpaul stuck up one hand and could only parry it over the rope. It would have been astounding had he held it
ideal yorker, at his feet, and he just about got the bat down in time, the ball trickling behind the stumps

driven hard and straight, Bradshaw gets a boot to the ball deflects into the stumps at the non-striker's end.  Bradshaw appeals and Jayawardene looks crestfallen. Several replays follow and it's mighty close, and in the end the batsman gets the benefit of the doubt, which is the right decision. It's one of those where the bat is out in one frame and in the next, and in between the bails come off
almost a replay of the previous drama, but this time Bradshaw cannot stop it and the ball evades mid-off as well
an attempted lofted drive but he didn't get to the pitch of it and the ball was skied into the off side ... but long-off could not get near to it
clipped off his legs to Powell at long leg
very correct defensive shot

leg-stump line, swept fine to bring up his 25th ODI hundred and his third in World Cups.  A superb innings - 86 balls in all and all after a poor and slow start - and once he got going, West Indies were unable to slow him down
pushed into the covers
driven to long-on
missed attempted flick off his legs, hitting all three but pitched outside leg stump
Jayasuriya gets everything behind the ball to defend
full toss on leg stump, well controlled steer to long leg
fullish on middle-and-leg, sweetly picked up and lofted over mid-on, and the ball has the legs to outpace the chasing fielder
Jayawardene far too early onto a pull shot and the ball lobs down off his arm and narrowly misses the stumps ... it dribbles to the leg side and allows a quick single
swished over point, very uppish, but the man is back on the rope and he has no chance of getting in
a beamer and an immediate apology from the bowler
sublime shot, no more than a gentle push but it raced past the bowler and long-on had to run round to cut it off
pushed out to deep backward point
swept to deep square leg
too wide, Jayawardene waits and cuts to the man on the rope
plonked into the leg side for a walk more than a run
a respite from the singles for Jayasuriya
heaved past midwicket and a comfortable two
paddled round to short fine leg
steered to third man, he half crouches and runs it off an open face
pushed to mid-on and a quick single as it bisected fielders
chipped over extra cover -  even his misshits are finding space - and that was the shot of a tired man.
turned behind square on the leg side
good yorker, squeezed into the off side and Jayasuriya quick to call for the single
checked drive in the air towards long-on, a buzz round the ground as the spectators anticipated the catch, but it reached Bradshaw on the bounce
turned behind square, to the left of short fine leg
swept square, Jayasuriya ran the second very quickly as the throw came in from the deep
edgy sweep to short fine leg
and that was just a long hop, pulled square and between the two men in the deep. Gayle is slow enough that the batsman can wait when they get the bad ball and put it where they want
swept 30 yards into the leg side and the pair walk the single
one step and driven to long-on
short, pulled behind square and long leg scurries round to field on the rope
full toss as he looks for the yorker, driven to long-off and an ambled single
slower one - 65mph - Jayawardene waits and clips into space around midwicket
a wide full toss, Jayasuriya drives with little footwork and drags the ball into his off stump. It was the shot of a tired man, but it cannot overshadow what has been a really excellent innings

forced onto the back foot by one fractionally short of a length and he drops the ball at his feet - he thinks about risking a single but Jayawardene, who must be feeling the heat and humidity himself, wants nothing to do with it
turned off his legs to long leg
good and straight
pushed to midwicket
he waits and flicks it very fine, evading the man there to stop the single, and Smith catches up with the ball  just inside the rope
driven back at the bowler and Gayle fields with his foot, getting a cheer as he flicks it up into his hands
paddled to the man in the deep on the leg side
missed attempted paddle, off the pad to short third man
creeps forward to defend and you couldn't slide tracing paper between his bat and his front foot if, for any random reason, you wanted to
quick single and the batsmen run their bat in very well. Bats even, they do have one each
played well off his legs
that's played solidly forward
driven straight to cover and there's some good commitment there from Lara, diving right onto that one
taken well off the toes and that's worked to square
driven out strongly
liked that one, testing the man with one which turned a bit outside off, and got the prod... but not the edge
Jayawardene would have been in trouble with a better throw from fine leg
lovely shot - offering his bat and sweeping it low behind square
driven out aerially over cover
does well to work out a full ball right behind point
on middle and that's driven in front of midwicket
driven out to long-off where the fielder waits, and casually scoops up the dribbling ball
good work in the deep by Bravo, on his toes and responsive as ever, to prevent them running the second
defended forward
walks into that one and drives it to mid-on
reverse sweep played awkwardly, but quite well, and they run two
taken from outside off and that's swept out to deep square. It's some effort to overstep off three paces, but anyway
worked around down to fine leg off the heel of the boot
rocks on to his back foot to drive that long out to extra cover
driven to cover, doesn't really get hold of the shot, however
on leg and that's swept square
short and the batsman makes room to cut. Yet again he oversteps... how?!
dropped. Awful. A straightforward chance for Dwayne Smith right out there in front of the midwicket boundary
driven to midwicket
brilliant yorker straight up, removes the off stick and Jayawardene just smiles. There's not much celebration on the field, low key only, and that's the end of a fine innings from Jayawardene
a touch of width outside off and that's driven straight to the man at cover
even more room and that's driven very well to extra cover, but Chanderpaul dives very well to make a very good save
late cut down to third man
shorter ball, on leg, and that's worked in front of midwicket
driven off the toes through midwicket
round the wicket, slower one, and that's driven to cover
slow fielding allowed the second, there, the batsman coming down the wicket and hitting it with the dead part of the bat over mid-on
just too full to be a good length and that's worked to midwicket off the toes, more shocking fielding - far from Bravo - and they get a second
full toss on the legs and that's worked to square
short, outside off, and the runs are flowing now, that one kept from being a four by Sarwan inside the cover boundary
walks into that one and has real intent in driving that wide of long-on and yet again Sri Lanka manage to get back for a second in the face of some casual West Indian fielding
round the wicket and the batsman looks to turn that one behind square
down on one knee and doesn't quite strike that one cleanly enough
tries something different, seeing the batsman coming, and trying to send that wide down leg for the stumping - Silva managed to get his pad on it
oh dear, backed right away trying to make room and carved that one right up to Lara at wide mid-off. Selfless shot, though, really, trying to boost Sri Lanka late on
on off, down on one knee, and that's swept, short, to square leg
swept finely to fine leg
driven out to cover
pushed right up there and driven out to point
pushed right up there and driven out to point
outside off and that's swished at
short, on leg, and that's gone all the way over the rope
a quick single
worked out to leg
down leg but that's too wide
pushed up there and that's dug into the leg side
pushed right up there again and that's driven to cover
outside off and that's driven to long-on
reverse swept behind square and that's an excellent shot indeed
another quick single to end the over and Sri Lanka have a chance to post 300
outside off and that's driven off the back foot to point
low full toss and that's driven on the up to the man at extra cover
outside off and that's driven off the back foot to cover
outside off and he tries to sweep that to leg
outside off and that's driven down the ground, for another poor misfield
outside off again and that's the biggest shot of the day to bring up the 300! Great shot from Dilshan, striking that up, up and away over midwicket right into the stands

inn2.comm: on off stump, Gayle into line to block
a hint of swing, all a bit gentle at 75mph, Gayle defends again
Gayle pushes into the covers
pushed to mid-off and Gayle off like a whippet out of the traps, that puts pressure on the fielder who falls over
played into the covers and the cordon in quickly
straight and pushed back to Vaas
up in the blockhole at 86mph, a foot short of a yorker, played to mid-off
super ball - 86.7mph - right through Gayle who seemed to struggle to pick the ball up. It's not that dark but Malinga's action is unusual
well, he picked that up alright! A half-volley outside off stump and Gayle smashes that over mid-off
slower ball, and again Gayle struggles to pick it up and plays a rather feeble jab which trickles back to Malinga
Gayle uses the pace of the ball to push to cover
superb yorker at almost 89mph, Gayle shuffles and keeps it out, but not with much to spare
Bravo seizes on a leg-stump delivery, fine leg is up and that was past him before he could blink
outside off stump and a little swing into the right-hander, Bravo back and into line
Bravo stands tall and punches that past the dive of extra cover. Bravo wanted the third but Gayle was anchored at the non-striker's end
worked off his hip to short midwicket ... he come in not more than eight or nine yards from the bat
Vaas strays to leg again, Bravo works it into space behind square
Gayle back and plays into the covers
outside off stump, Bravo reaches a bit further than he wanted and pats the ball to cover
Malinga goes wide again and this time Bravo angles the ball down to third man
Gayle again looks uncertain, no footwork and a parry at the ball with bat well away from body
much better connection, driven to mid-on
Gayle works the ball down to third man, all under control
bouncer, possibly sliding down the leg side, Bravo starts to duck and then freezes like a rabbit in the headlights as the ball zips past
Gayle turns the ball down to fine leg
swings into Bravo who pushes to mid-on and sets of for the single ... he gets halfway down the track and then realises Gayle is rooted like a tree in the non-striker's crease
Bravo drops the ball to extra cover and again sets off, this time Gayle is wise to his partner's antics and responds, and it is Bravo who has to stretch to beat the throw ...which missed anyway
Gayle blocks a ball that pitched on middle
Gayle jabs at a ball outside off and misses, a few gasps until the close fielders realise Mark Benson has called a no-ball
movement from outside off stump to even further outside, Gayle not interested
squeezed to third man, Gayle turned a little square
Bravo barely moves, standing back he plays a remarkable one-handed swat past cover, and the speed of the ball takes it almost to the rope

done by the slower ball. It was wide of off stump as well, so Gayle had to reach to drive, it  went a long way up and Fernando, who was circling under the swirling ball as it descended from the heavens, held a good two-handed catch above his head two-thirds of the way towards the long-on boundary
Bravo jabs down uncertainly
a neat and wristy flick through the gap at midwicket
down the leg, past the batsman and also past Sangakkara who perches on his haunches with an expression of bewilderment
fires one in with real venom, but he pulls it with his round-arm style too wide for the umpire's liking
Bravo back, right on his stumps, and he drives superbly through the covers
into line, all correct and everything behind it
forward, played firmly to the man at very short extra cover
Chanderpaul turned square by an outswinger, the line was such that he had to play and the ball zipped past the outside edge
Chanderpaul reaches more for this one and prods to cover
Chanderpaul again turned a little square as he blocks that one
driven without any power into the covers
into the off side, a low-key end to a good over from Vaas
what a great start, a ripping yorker which sends Bravo, off balance, tottering into the off side like a drunk as he struggles to keep the ball out. Shame it was a no-ball!
powerful drive, he stood back and then leaned into the shot, sending the ball racing past extra cover who never had a chance
and another rasping cover drive, this time well stopped by a diving fielder
back and punched to point who moves three paces to his left to field
Bravo surprised by pace and bounce, and the fact the ball was speared in at him, and he can only fend it up towards mid-on. Safe but not pretty
thuds into Bravo's pads, a strangulated appeal from Fernando
shorter, and Bravo whips if off his hips behind square on the leg side
full outside off stump, squirted to point
airy drive though third/fourth slip, Malinga sprints round and makes a sliding stop at third man
Bravo is undone by the inswing which takes the ball past his defensive jab, flicks the top of his pad and onto the stumps
Vaas makes Lara play, which he does with ease
Lara takes a big stride and drives to mid-off
Lara again leans into the drive, the pace of the ball means that a diving cover only half stops it
fullish length, Chanderpaul defends with ease
that had some extra oomph - 89mph - and Chanderpaul leaves it as it shoots past his off stump
crisp drive behind square and well stopped
well-timed clip off his legs, but straight to midwicket. A yard either side and he might have got four there, he hit it so well
virtual yorker, Chanderpaul down on it well, the ball races to backward point and knocks the man over as he stops it
the ball flies over the top of off stump, left alone on length by Chanderpaul

Lara falls! That's some quick work by Sangakkara, Lara dragging his back foot forward and his foot is in the air. The third umpire needed more than a second eye for that one, but he was clearly out, and Lara's on his way. Tidy work indeed from the keeper, standing up to Vaas. Boos ring out around the ground at that decision, but you can't argue with it
poked into the covers
left alone outside off and that flies through to the keeper
on off and that's driven wide to mid-on where it's winged back in
pushed right up there and that's defended
right up there and driven out, slowly, to cover
short, and on off, and that's defended down off the back foot
more tidy defence. That's not going to help the run rate, which is steadily creeping up - it's now 6.8
on off and that's prodded down into the covers
half appeal for one which was going over
defended down
the batsman is being more defensive here and that was defended down
poked off the back foot into the covers
that one's straight and it's nurdled off the front foot behind square
straight again, much like a non-loaded die, and that's defended once more
outside off and that's cut away inside the cover boundary
outside off and that's defended down off the back foot
left alone outside off
outside off and that's driven away off the back foot through the covers on the up, but there's some tidy relay fielding inside the boundary
defended forward
short, outside off and that's cut away down to third man off the back foot
driven out to long-off
outside off and that seams away from the lefthander
outside off and that's thick edged away to a wide third man
defended on the front foot
driven to cover
more driving, again to cover
defended forward
on off and that's driven to mid-on and that would have been close had he have hit
a loud, long, but ultimately fruitless appeal for one which would have gone over
defended forward
pushed on to the back foot to defend again
short, outside off and that's poked down off the back foot into the covers
turns in from outside off but the batsman makes room to play that down to short third man
rolls his wrists over that one and works it to midwicket
round the wicket and bends that in at Chanderpaul who gets over it and works it to square
straight and that's driven forward for a quick single
poked down to gully
turned round in front of square and that's an easy single
another easy single
comes forward and tthe strike's rotated again with a mere push
looks to work that to leg off the back foot but takes the power off the shot
pitches straight and turns down leg, and the batsman rushes it to fine leg
dibbled down into short midwicket and the batsman sets off to run, but quickly comes back
a definite single is on this time, with that push into the covers
some loop on that one, but the batsman gets right over it and works it to square
a good line and length, right up there in front of off, and that's defended forward
walks backwards to give himself room to cut a fairly straight delivery out to point
that one pitches just outside off and creeps back in to the batsman, who can only defend
hint of an appeal there, for one which pitches outside off and seems to take the edge, Sangakkara looking for the stumping there, but his foot was well back
pressed down behind square
defended down
reaches out for that one, which he works square
tickles that one to short midwicket
outside off and that's left alone
keeps him quiet with one that he defends down in front of off stump
played back to the bowler
outside off and that's square-driven out to point
pushed into the gap at short midwicket but there's soon a fielder who gets on to that one
driven out to midwicket
driven to cover and there's an easy single, but definitely not a second
shorter ball fended down into the gully easily enough
driven to short midwicket and there's some good tidy diving by Dilshan
driven to mid-on
played into the covers
short, outside off, and that's played down off the back foot to gully
driven to mid-off
outside off and that's worked in front of point
comes forward and plays that one straight
walks into that one to defend
gets over that one and eases it, with smooth wrists, to midwicket
poked into the covers, defensively, to defend
pushed gently to backward point
thick inside edge into the on side
inswing that hit pad and then bat, clearly in that order, and a loud and confident shout but it hit him fractionally outside the line

dropped short and wide, slashed hard to the right of Dilshan at backward point, he dived and made a super one-handed attempt to hold on to the ball. He spilled it but that was travelling and would have been a brilliant catch
worked down to third man
banged in but too wayward and far too high, a simple decision for the umpire, a wide for height or width, take your pick
patted to mid-off
forward, blocked with ease
swept to the leg side
flighted and Chanderpaul gets a thick edge, the ball squirming to backward point
pushed to mid-off
turns across Chanderpaul who gets another thick outside edge, all along the ground and past a diving slip
outside leg, the ball turns not a jot and it continues on its merry way through to Sangakkara who whips off the bails, because he can
blocked , much as he would as if this was the second day of a Test
over the ball and steered to third man
wide, Chanderpaul places that between two men square on the off and it's the first boundary in 17 overs
short and wide, Chanderpaul stands up and smashes that square, Dilshan  at point leaps to his left and makes a breathtaking one-handed stop
patted back to the bowler
straight drive, well hit, Fernando drops a hand and half stops but cannot prevent the single as the ball bobbles to mid-off
in the blockhole but wide, steered right into the hands of point
a bit more flight, driven to mid-on
on leg stump, not much turn, clipped to midwicket. A rather unnecessary throw at the stumps scores a hit but the ball shoots away allowing an overthrow
tossed up outside off stump, a wild drive which he misses
another one that rips past the left-hander
this is a man against a boy ... again Murali zips one past the edge
at last he loses his line and Chanderpaul finds space on the leg side
Chanderpaul stands tall and blocks
angled in to the left-hander at 83mph, Chanderpaul gets right into line and dead-bats the ball
faster - 89mph - wide of off stump, Chanderpaul looks to cut but is beaten by the extra pace
and again, same line and length, Chanderpaul slightly off balance as he tries to cut and he misses for a second time
fuller, driven to backward point
Chanderpaul drives into the covers, Silva leaps to his left to make yet another outstanding stop
Sarwan forward to kill the spin
Sarwan sweeps from outside leg stump, gets a thick bottom edge and the ball goes fine
up into Sarwan's feet, it hits his pads - well outside leg stump - and into the on side
worked square on the leg side and a well-run single
Sarwan steps to leg and smacks the ball to third man
Chanderpaul takes two paces to get to the pitch of the ball and launches it over the long-on boundary
good start, tight and no chance for anything other than a block
on the button again
too short, Sarwan steps back and powers that past extra cover
Chanderpaul tries to flick to leg, misses, and it hits him on the pad
wide, cut to backward point, Chanderpaul sets off but has to scurry back as Sarwan not interested
this time he does flick it to leg, Sarwan's turn to think of a second but Chanderpaul, who would have been running to the danger end, quick to call no
full, swept fine but there's a man there for just that shot
same line and length, but this one spits past the outside edge
up in the blockhole, well played into the covers
Chanderpaul read that one, and shouldered arms as it turned away from him
tip-and-run, no more than ten feet into the leg side, a quick call and  a good run
Sarwan cuts to deep backward point
pulled short, a bad delivery, and Sarwan rocks back and smashes that over square leg. A good shot and it got just what is deserved
well placed, a single to mid-off
off the pad, into the off side and a suicidal run, but it's come to that. Sangakkara shies at the bowler's end, Chanderpaul was out if it hit despite the dive ... but the ball missed
back and cut into the covers
pushed drive to the man in th deep on the off side
wide, Chanderpaul tries to cut but misses, and he lifts his eyes to the heavens
full, driven back over a leaping Murali - he as never going to catch it - and the men in the deep mop up
full, driven back at the feet of Murali
tossed up, patted to short extra cover
cut to backward point who is in on it quickly
again flighted outside off stump, this time the drive beats short extra cover
Sarwan steps back to cut and manages to do so even though the ball rips back into him
swept from outside off stump, the man at deep backward square leg fields
one step, two step, and thwacked to deep midwicket on the half volley
flicked to short fine leg, Jayawardene picks up and hurls ten yards to Sangakkara who has to leap to his right to prevent overthrows. Wayward and his expression shows he knows that
again he uses his feet and thwacks it over midwicket
driven to wide long-on
Sarwan leans back and thumps that high over extra cover, deep cover and long-off combine to prevent too much damage
swept through straight midwicket from outside off stump. Muralitharan won't mind that one bit

flighted , Sarwan gets cramped as he tries to loft the ball over long-on, Malinga runs in but not in time and collects on the bounce. Murali is not happy as he seems to think the fielder should have been quicker to set off
slog-sweep all the way over midwicket, about time!
tip-and-run to point, more cheers
Sarwan misses a straight one, a loud appeal but it was drifting down the leg
plopped into the leg side, but the fielders are wise to the quick singles and are really on their toes
Chanderpaul dances down the track to greet the ball and flicks it to deep midwicket

Sarwan plays a pretty horrible cross-batted heave, misses and Sangakkara whips off the bails as Sarwan twists and jams his bat down. He doesn't make it in time, it's a second neat stumping by the keeper, and the third umpire presses the button after a cursory glance at the replay
pushed up to long-on
worked fine on the off side
firm drive up the ground ... but a run a ball is not enough as they are nearing needing two a ball
a very wristy and effective flick to deep midwicket
down on one knee and swishes that all the way over midwicket and that's a great clean strike to bring up his half-century
better length, up there, but Chanderpaul still manages to drive it to long-off
on middle and he presses forward to defend
sends that one in on leg, it moves a touch and is driven out to mid-off
on leg and that's pulled round to square, the batsman having to do all the work as the pace is right off the ball

that's straight, very straight, and the umpire needs no time to give that one out. Neither do all three armchair umpires in our office, who instantly trigger their fingers, too; well, it was plumber than a plum pudding that's had extra plums wodged in there
outside off and that spins a touch back in to the lefthander, who drives it back mid-off
down on one knee to one which pitches on off and he did well to get bat on that to sweep; if he missed, he was gone
defended to cover

ah, a risky two to short  third man, too risky. Malinga has a very good arm and that, allied to Sangakkara's fast hands, means the third umpire's finger is not long behind when the throw comes in to the striker's end
lbw call and that's close, but no cigar, or, curcuially, trigg-ar - HawkEye had that missing leg, according with Umpire Benson
that one's defended down
driven back to the bowler
on leg, that turns back in and it's played back out
on leg and that's worked out in front of square
poked down off the back foot to gully and there's a quick single
pitches on leg and goes on straight, there's a half-shout for lbw, but there was definite edge on it as it's worked down to gully
a bit of fun for the crowd, there, six all the way with a lovely aerial swish over long on
Ramdin goes to sweep that one, it sails high and Vaas catches that one at deep midwicket, running in to cling on
clipped away for an easy single
outside off and that's prodded forward in defence
outside off, that turns back into the batsman who nudges it to mid-on
driven off the toes through midwicket and that's picked up cleanly
on off and that's chipped just inside the midwicket boundary, and just in front of the field
up there and that's Russell-style poked down into the leg side
on off and that's punched down the ground for a slow single
right up there, and he could only stifle that one
on the money once more and that's defended quietly
liking that one, a slower delivery that whispers past the outside edge, threatening to kiss the edge but merely flirting in the end
eased away down to deep third man
outside off and that's swept behind square
defended forward
an easy single
swept in the air - but safe - to square
outside off and that's swept down to square
played out to point off the back foot to steal the strike
another six! Stepping down and launching that right over square leg. We like that one
good reply from Malinga, right up in the blockhole, Chanderpaul aiming to pull that one, playing right over it, and knocking out the off stump
got that one from the box labelled "Sturdy defence" - had to be expecting the yorker, there, to be fair, and we are, and so was that shot
another yorker, and the batsman just managed to dig that one out again, his bottom hand flying up off the bat
slower delivery this time, not picked, and that just pops over the inner ring. He gets off the mark, for what it's worth, which is not much
driven strongly straight back over the bowler's head and that runs on its merry way for four
pushed right up there and that was defended
swished at that one, didn't get hold of it
... but did this time, taking that one from outside off and that's worked just in front of square
opens the face, a touch awkwardly, and runs that down to third man
opens the face, a touch awkwardly, and runs that down to third man
outside off and that's driven slowly straight to mid-on
on leg and that's padded into the leg side
outside off and Tharanga fluffs that one, trying to pick it up on the bounce, as the ball runs away to the rope off the midwicket hoick
very nice shot, Taylor delicately dinking that one very fine

pitched in-line and just did enough to go on to hit the stumps. All the team go up for that one, trying to Umpire Harper's decision much easier. He didn't really need their help, squinting through his yellow lenses to give that one
outside off and that straightens, but was too high
driven out to mid-off
outside off and that's driven slowly off the back foot to point
outside off and that was driven to long-on
and that's it. Cleaned up by some tidy work and that's a comprehensive win for Sri Lanka
